Total_Links:
Q4 FY24-25 showed increased bookings, revenues, and a threefold rise in profit before tax.

The company announced a dividend of Rs 5.0 per share on May 23, 2025.

For the first time in five years, GVT&D became debt-free.

Annual revenue grew by 36.5%.

Profit growth was 142.50% over the past three years.

Order inflow reached Rs 29.9 billion, largely from domestic orders.

The order book hit a record high of Rs 126.6 billion.

INR 1,400 million is being invested to enhance manufacturing, particularly for the energy sector and HVDC projects.

A capex of ~Rs 2.4 billion was announced for new capacity and existing capacity improvements.

A new facility for HVDC and FACTS equipment is expected by FY27.

Adjusted EBITDA margin expanded significantly to 23.2% in Q4 FY25.
